isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION 12: HIGH PRESSURE LUBE OIL SYSTEM - HIGH PRESSURE PUMP - REMOVAL

svcproc.title: REMOVAL
svcproc.para: Use the following steps to remove the high pressure lube oil pump.

caution.para: BEFORE PERFORMING THIS PROCEDURE, BE SURE THE HIGH PRESSURE PUMP RESERVOIR HAS BEEN DRAINED OF OIL. DRAIN THE RESERVOIR BY REMOVING THE ENGINE OIL TEMPERATURE SENSOR (figure 12.26) FROM THE REAR HALF OF THE FRONT COVER. EXTRACT OIL BY INSERTING THE TUBE FROM THE HAND OPERATED VACUUM PUMP TOOL ZTSE2499 INTO THE COVER (FIGURE 12.27).

note.para: IF THE IPR VALVE HAS NOT BEEN REMOVED, BE SURE THE IPR VALVE SOLENOID HAS BEEN DISCONNECTED FROM THE MAIN WIRING HARNESS (FIGURE 12.21 or 12.22).
BE SURE the lube oil supply hose has been disconnected, refer to "Supply Manifold Removal" in this section, for the proper removal procedures.

step1.para: Remove two (2) capscrews securing high pressure lube pump to front cover. Remove pump and gasket from front cover

step2.para:
Figure 12.28
shows the high pressure pump on engines with serial number 988150 and below.

Figure 12.29
shows the high pressure pump on engines with serial number 988151 and up.
